definitions: causing an uncomfortable sensation on the skin that makes one want to scratch
examples: The mosquito bites made her skin extremely itchy
He developed an itchy rash from the poison ivy

definitions: involving repetition of a process or sequence, especially to achieve gradual improvement
examples: The iterative design process improved the product incrementally
Software development often follows an iterative methodology

definitions: traveling from place to place, especially to perform work or fulfill professional duties
examples: The itinerant preacher traveled between rural churches
She lived an itinerant lifestyle as a touring musician

definitions: having the green color characteristic of jade stone
examples: She wore a beautiful jade dress to the gala
The lake had a distinctive jade color

definitions: tired, bored, or lacking enthusiasm after excessive exposure to something once exciting
examples: The jaded critic found nothing impressive about the film
Years of disappointment left him feeling jaded about politics

definitions: having a rough, sharp, or uneven edge with many pointed parts
examples: The jagged rocks made climbing dangerous
She cut herself on the jagged edge of broken glass

definitions: confined in jail or prison as a legal punishment
examples: The jailed activist continued protesting from behind bars
Several jailed politicians were released after the election

definitions: stuck and unable to move or function properly
filled with people or things packed tightly together
examples: The jammed printer needed professional repair
The jammed mechanism prevented the door from opening
The jammed stadium erupted when the home team scored
Traffic was completely jammed during rush hour

definitions: causing a harsh, unpleasant, or shocking effect, especially through discord or contrast
examples: The jarring noise interrupted the peaceful afternoon
His jarring comments disrupted the diplomatic meeting

definitions: having or expressing a lively, cheerful, and self-confident manner
examples: He wore his hat at a jaunty angle
She walked with a jaunty spring in her step

definitions: having a jaw of a specified type, usually used in combination
examples: The square-jawed detective looked imposing
A strong-jawed man appeared in the doorway

definitions: bright, colorful, and showy in appearance or style
having the lively, syncopated rhythm characteristic of jazz music
examples: She wore a jazzy outfit to the party
The jazzy pattern caught everyone's attention
The band played a jazzy version of the classic song
His jazzy piano style impressed the audience

definitions: feeling or showing envy of someone's achievements, advantages, or relationships
fiercely protective of one's rights, possessions, or position
examples: She felt jealous when her ex started dating someone new
He was jealous of his colleague's promotion
The company was jealous of its trade secrets
He remained jealous of his reputation

definitions: characterized by sudden, irregular movements or stops and starts
having the tough, dried texture characteristic of preserved meat
examples: The old film had jerky movements typical of early cinema
His jerky driving made everyone carsick
The jerky texture made it difficult to chew
This tastes like jerky beef

definitions: having a deep, intense black color like jet stone
examples: Her jet hair gleamed in the sunlight
The cat had beautiful jet fur

definitions: decorated or adorned with jewels or precious stones
examples: She wore a jeweled crown for the ceremony
The jeweled dagger gleamed in the display case

definitions: decorated or adorned with jewels or precious stones
examples: The jewelled tiara sparkled under the lights
He presented her with a jewelled brooch

definitions: relating to or involved in Islamic militant struggle or holy war
examples: Jihadi groups claimed responsibility for the attack
Intelligence agencies tracked jihadi networks

definitions: suddenly rejected or abandoned by a lover, especially after engagement
examples: The jilted bride sued for breach of promise
His jilted lover sought revenge

definitions: without a job; unemployed and seeking work
examples: The jobless rate increased during the recession
Many jobless workers struggled to pay bills

definitions: connected, linked, or united into one piece or entity
examples: The joined pieces formed a complete picture
Their joined hands symbolized unity

definitions: shared, held, or done by two or more parties together
relating to a point where two parts are connected
examples: They opened a joint bank account after marriage
The joint committee reached a unanimous decision
He suffered from joint pain in his knees
The joint mobility improved after therapy

definitions: having joints or articulations allowing movement between connected parts
examples: The jointed doll could be posed realistically
Bamboo has naturally jointed stems

definitions: said or done in jest; not serious or meant humorously
examples: His joking manner lightened the tense atmosphere
She made a joking comment about the situation

definitions: happy, cheerful, and full of good humor and festive spirit
examples: The jolly innkeeper welcomed all his guests warmly
They had a jolly time at the holiday party

definitions: relating to or characteristic of journalism or journalists and their work
examples: Her journalistic integrity was never questioned
The book lacked journalistic standards of accuracy

definitions: cheerful and friendly in manner; full of hearty good humor
examples: The jovial host made everyone feel welcome
His jovial personality made him popular at parties

definitions: feeling, expressing, or causing great happiness and delight
examples: The joyful reunion brought tears to their eyes
Children's joyful laughter filled the playground

definitions: full of happiness and joy; characterized by great delight
examples: The wedding was a joyous celebration
They received joyous news about the baby

definitions: feeling or expressing great happiness and triumph, especially after success
examples: The jubilant crowd celebrated their team's victory
She was jubilant after receiving her acceptance letter

definitions: having or displaying an excessively critical point of view about others
examples: Her judgmental attitude alienated potential friends
Try not to be so judgmental about their choices

definitions: relating to judges, law courts, or the administration of justice
examples: The judicial system needs significant reform
She sought judicial review of the decision

definitions: having, showing, or done with good judgment or sense; wise and sensible
examples: She made judicious use of her limited resources
His judicious investments paid off handsomely

definitions: relating to the throat or neck, especially the main veins
examples: The jugular vein carries blood from the head
He applied pressure to the jugular area

definitions: containing a lot of juice; succulent and moist
interestingly scandalous or sensational; full of interesting details
examples: The juicy peaches were perfect for eating
She bit into the juicy watermelon slice
The tabloid published juicy gossip about celebrities
He shared some juicy details about the scandal

definitions: mixed up in a confused or untidy way; lacking order
examples: The jumbled papers made finding the document difficult
His jumbled thoughts prevented clear communication

definitions: very large; much bigger than usual for its type
examples: They ordered jumbo shrimp for the party
The jumbo jet carried over 400 passengers

definitions: lower in rank or status within an organization
younger in age or of the younger of two people with same name
examples: The junior partner handled routine cases
She started as a junior executive
Robert Smith Junior inherited his father's business
The junior members of the family sat separately

definitions: relating to judicial proceedings or the administration of law
examples: The juridical framework governed all legal proceedings
They discussed juridical implications of the new policy

definitions: relating to the official power to make legal decisions within a particular area
examples: The court faced jurisdictional challenges to its authority
They resolved the jurisdictional dispute between states

definitions: able to be shown as right or reasonable; defensible
examples: Her anger was completely justifiable given the circumstances
The expense was justifiable for safety reasons

definitions: having been shown to be right or reasonable; warranted
having text aligned evenly along the margin
examples: His concerns were fully justified by subsequent events
She felt justified in reporting the misconduct
The justified text looked neat and professional
Use left-justified formatting for this document

definitions: sticking out, up, or forward; projecting prominently
examples: The jutting cliff provided shelter from the rain
His jutting chin gave him a determined look

definitions: relating to young people, especially those below adult age
childish and immature in behavior or thinking
examples: The juvenile court handles cases involving minors
Juvenile diabetes affects children and teenagers
His juvenile behavior embarrassed his colleagues
They engaged in juvenile pranks at the office

definitions: placed close together or side by side, especially for comparison or contrast
examples: The juxtaposed images highlighted their differences
Modern buildings were juxtaposed with historic architecture

definitions: having complex patterns of colors or elements constantly changing like a kaleidoscope
examples: The kaleidoscopic display of lights dazzled the audience
Her kaleidoscopic imagination produced endless creative ideas

definitions: having or showing eagerness or enthusiasm; very interested
intellectually sharp; having a fine edge for perception
intense or strong in degree or feeling
examples: She was keen to start her new job immediately
He showed keen interest in the project
Her keen intelligence impressed the interview panel
His keen eye spotted the error immediately
The keen wind cut through their winter coats
She felt keen disappointment at the news

definitions: maintained in a particular state or condition; retained in possession
examples: The well-kept garden impressed all the visitors
These kept secrets eventually came to light

definitions: of crucial importance; fundamental to understanding or achieving something
examples: Trust is a key element in any relationship
She played a key role in the negotiations

definitions: in a state of nervous excitement or tension
adjusted or tuned to a particular musical key or pitch
examples: She was keyed up before her important presentation
The students were keyed up for the final exam
The instruments were keyed to the same pitch
The piano was keyed perfectly for the concert
